thread.title: Elon Musk says, 'Yo, I don't hate Apple'
thread.title_full: Elon Musk says, 'Yo, I don't hate Apple'

title: Elon Musk says, 'Yo, I don't hate Apple'
text:
Elon Musk says, 'Yo, I don't hate Apple' By Jose Pagliery @Jose_Pagliery Elon Musk Elon Musk tried to clear the air with Apple on Friday night -- sort of. 
There's some concern Apple is poaching engineers at his company, Tesla ( TSLA ) , to build an Apple car. Musk recently bashed Apple as a "Tesla graveyard," saying that it's merely hiring the engineers his company has fired. 
Then on Friday, Musk sent out a small peace offering on Twitter. 
"Yo, I don't hate Apple," he tweeted, "It's a great company with a lot of talented people. I love their products and I'm glad they're doing an EV." Yo, I don't hate Apple. It's a great company with a lot of talented people. I love their products and I'm glad they're doing an EV. — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) October 9, 2015 
But here's the thing. EV stands for "electric vehicle." 
Apple ( AAPL , Tech30 ) hasn't confirmed the numerous rumors that it's working on a high-tech car. There's a mountain of clues , though: It's been hiring auto executives , poaching auto battery engineers , and driving a test vehicle around California . 
Musk followed up that tweet with a nod at the team that created the Apple Watch. 
"Regarding the watch, Jony & his team created a beautiful design, but the functionality isn't compelling yet. By version 3, it will be." Regarding the watch, Jony & his team created a beautiful design, but the functionality isn't compelling yet. By version 3, it will be. — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) October 9, 2015 
At least there weren't any spoilers in that one.
